intro: Microtis longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved microtis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, delicate flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats such as heathlands and woodland margins. Microtis longifolia is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to well-drained, nutrient-poor soils.
